content.description: Start matched on the right arete as low as you can, throw to a shitty greasy slopey thing and make your way left to mantle at the left edge. The cracked boulder at the bottom left is off. Tiny. What was I thinking?
content.protection: You start sitting on a big embedded rock so a pad for that. On red flag days you can feel the static electricity on the lines from where you are, it adds some spice to your slap.

content.description:
AKA

Slab Me Silly

. Follow a rail system to a ledge. Feels like you're going to fall off the cliff. Fun!
content.protection: Pad and a spotter, there is an abyss you can fall and die in if you decide you'd like to do that or more likely a hold breaks.
content.location: At the freeway side of an outcropping in the 24 Boulder Area. On the trail to the Irish Boulders stay left before descending. A short walk along a faint and slippery path getsyou to this climb. Go back along this trail and down to get to the Irish Boulders.

content.description:
Aka "Alex's Bulge". SDS with your feet in the crack, hands on the lip. Make your way up to a jug and rock on. Tougher than it looks, you'll earn your single point here. FA was in the dark!

Here's Alex running a lap a long time ago:

youtube.com/watch?v=RBYVG_vâ€¦

There is a really cool traverse on the same face as

Pamela (5.6R)

that could be classified as being in the same area as these lines. Start as for Pamela  and head right until you can't anymore (the climbing continues through the tree). Gets a little highball and is very fun. Try starting further and further left. Can you 'round the corner? FA Alex Ostrovsky.
content.location:
After warming up at the Mystery Boulders head up the trail from Hangout Traverse to catch the Powerline Trail. Walk this until it flattens out and you see a boulder on your right side with a 24 painted on it. Walk around the corner of this boulder. The 24 boulder itself has fun warmup problems scattered on it's small face. Would be good for kids. Just under the powerlines is the somewhat hidden trail to the Irish Boulders and 24 Arete

Other Info:

This used to be the site of the "old" parking lot before the electrocution death of a local on the towers  shut down access in the early years of roped-climbing development. Please keep your anti-gravity efforts on the boulders.

Link to LA Times article

(be warned, it is a very sad read)

content.description:
Start real low on the obvious pocket then work your way up the clear line.

(Also referred to as One Way Ticket to Goobtown)
content.location: To the right of the 24 boulder between the 24 mantle and Sad but True.
